trivia

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • trivia.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bullet, FightingActor

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic class for all objects in the game that both move and paint.
    Author:
    Cody Swendrowski, Dan Miller

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Actor(GameEngine e)
      Creates a new Actor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkCollision(Actor other)
      Checks to see if Actor is colliding with another Actor.
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the Actor.
      java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float getCenter()
      Returns center of Actor in a Point2D.Float format.
      java.awt.Polygon getDrawnPoly()
      Returns Polygon used for drawing
      java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float getVelocity()
      Returns velocity of Actor in a Point2D.Float format.
      boolean isDead()
      Returns true if Actor is dead; else, returns false.
      void move(int ms)
      Moves the Actor.
      void setBasePoly(java.awt.Polygon poly)
      Sets the basePoly, which is the default shape of the Actor, to a new Polygon.
      void setCenter(float x, float y)
      Sets the center of the Actor by first transforming the basePoly (and drawPoly if not null) to (0,0), then transforms to new center.
      void setDeath(boolean d)
      Sets the death boolean of Actor.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Allows System to print name of object.

        public void setCenter(float x,
             float y)

        y - Y co-ordinate of center
